info

Class ToolkitValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.ToolkitValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ToolkitConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RCCalcValidator

    public class ToolkitValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ToolkitConstants
    Provide operations to support input field validation. These include: - checking that a parameter value is within a given range - checking that an energy value is within acceptable limits - collecting and reporting multiple input errors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToolkitValidator

        public ToolkitValidator(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                        java.util.Properties toolkitProperties)
        Construct a validation object.
        Parameters:
        request - The browser generated request packet object.
        toolkitProperties - The set of toolkit properties. The validation object obtains limit information, regular expresssions and some miscellaneous constants from the toolkit properties. NOTE: When convenient, remove the session and toolkitParameters. The session is deriveable from the request object. Toolkit properties can be obtained using static methods on the Toolkit class.

    • Method Detail

      • validateLongitudeParameter

        public java.lang.String validateLongitudeParameter(java.lang.String paramName,
                                                   java.lang.String paramColorKey,
                                                   java.lang.String fieldKey)
        Indicate whether or not a named parameter's value is a valid Longitude value.. supported formats: HH:MM:SS.SSS HH MM SS.SSS Decimal degrees
        Parameters:
        paramName - Parameter name, key in request/session.
        paramColorKey - Parameter box color, key in request/session.
        fieldKey - Property key giving the field label.
        Returns:
        null if parameter value is valid, otherwise an error message.

        Parameters:
        paramName - Parameter name, key in request/session.
        paramColorKey - Parameter box color, key in request/session.
        rangeKey - Property key giving the valid range limits.
        fieldKey - Property key giving the field label.
        Returns:
        null if parameter value is valid, otherwise an error message.

        Build and return a JavaScript program which will popup an alert box detailing the reasons that the input is in error.
        Parameters:
        reasons - A list of field names and associated causes for the error.
        Returns:
        the JavaScript program (script) which produces a popup detailing any input errors and the associated cause.

      • errorsOccurred

        public boolean errorsOccurred(java.lang.String[] errors)
        Return an indication that errors have occurred.
        Parameters:
        errors - An array of error strings. A null indicates that no error occurred.
        Returns:
        true if any error strings are non null.

      • getEnergyRangeKey

        public java.lang.String getEnergyRangeKey(java.lang.String io)
        Return the name of the property which specifies the default energy range for a particular mission and instrument.
        Parameters:
        io - A prefix that specifies either input or output energy range.
        Returns:
        The key to use to access energy range.

      • validateEquinoxParameter

        public java.lang.String validateEquinoxParameter(java.lang.String fieldNameKey,
                                                 java.lang.String label,
                                                 java.lang.String parName)
        Indicate whether or not an input parameter is a valid equinox value.
        Parameters:
        fieldNameKey - A key for accessing the field name property.
        label - The name of the GUI input box label to be colored if an error is encountered.
        parName - The name of the GUI input box component to be error checked.
        Returns:
        null if the input parameter parName is valid or an error reason if the input is invalid.

      • validateInputPosition

        public java.lang.String validateInputPosition(java.lang.String fieldNameKey,
                                              java.lang.String positionCode,
                                              java.lang.String label,
                                              java.lang.String par)
        Indicate whether or not an input parameter has an acceptable value.
        Parameters:
        fieldNameKey - The key for accessing the field name property.
        positionCode - Identifies the input position class: RA, L2 or EL versus Dec, B2 or EB.
        label - The name of the GUI input box label to be colored if an error is encountered.
        par - The name of the GUI input box component to be error checked.
        Returns:
        null if the input parameter parName is valid or an error reason if the input is invalid.

      • validateParameter

        public java.lang.String validateParameter(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                          java.lang.String label,
                                          java.lang.String parName,
                                          java.lang.String rangeKey)
        Indicate whether or not a named parameter's value falls in a range.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field being checked. Used as a prefix for the reason code.
        label - The name of the GUI input box label.
        parName - The name of the GUI input box component.
        rangeKey - The value range property key.
        Returns:
        null if the input is valid or an error reason if the input is invalid.

      • validateParameter

        public java.lang.String validateParameter(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                          java.lang.String label,
                                          java.lang.String parName)
        Indicate whether or not a named parameter has a numeric value.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field being checked. Uses as a prefix for the reason code.
        label - The name of the GUI input box label.
        parName - The name of the GUI input box component.
        Returns:
        null if the input is a valid number or an error reason if the input is invalid.

      • validateParameter

        public java.lang.String validateParameter(java.lang.String fieldNameKey,
                                          java.lang.String regexp,
                                          java.lang.String label,
                                          java.lang.String parName,
                                          java.lang.String rangeKey)
        Indicate whether or not a named parameter's value falls in a specified range. Use a specific regular expression to check the input parameter syntax.
        Parameters:
        fieldNameKey - The prefix for the reason code. This parameter identifies the field by name. It is usually the field label.
        regexp - Identifies the input position class: RA, L2 or EL versus Dec, B2 or EB.
        label - The name of the GUI input box label.
        parName - The name of the GUI input box component.
        rangeKey - The value range property key. This toolkit range property identifies the acceptable limits for the parameter's value.
        Returns:
        null if the input is valid or an error reason if the input is invalid.

        public java.lang.String validateRangeLow(java.lang.String fieldNameKey,
                                         java.lang.String lowLabel,
                                         java.lang.String rangeLimitKey,

                                         java.lang.String highParameterName,

        public java.lang.String validateRangeHigh(java.lang.String fieldNameKey,

                                          java.lang.String rangeKey,
                                          java.lang.String lowParameterName,

      • validateRangeLow

        public java.lang.String validateRangeLow(java.lang.String fieldNameKey,
                                         java.lang.String lowLabel,
                                         java.lang.String rangeLimitKey,
                                         java.lang.String lowParameterName,
                                         java.lang.String highParameterName)
        Indicate whether a parameter being used as a lower limit in a pair is less than the upper limit and that it falls in a specified range.
        Parameters:
        fieldNameKey - A key for accessing the field name property.
        lowLabel - The name of the GUI input box label.
        rangeLimitKey - range limit key name
        lowParameterName - The name of the GUI input parameter holding the low value in the range.
        highParameterName - The name of the GUI input parameter holding the high value in the range.
        Returns:
        null if the input is valid or an error reason if the input is invalid.

      • validateRangeHigh

        public java.lang.String validateRangeHigh(java.lang.String fieldNameKey,
                                          java.lang.String highLabel,
                                          java.lang.String rangeKey,
                                          java.lang.String lowParameterName,
                                          java.lang.String highParameterName)
        Indicate whether or not a parameter which is the higher value in a range is acceptable, ie that it is greater than a low value and between a range of acceptable limits.
        Parameters:
        fieldNameKey - A key for accessing the field name property.
        highLabel - The name of the GUI input box label.
        rangeKey - A key for accessing the range property.
        lowParameterName - The name of the GUI input parameter holding the low value in the range.
        highParameterName - The name of the GUI input parameter holding the high value in the range.
        Returns:
        null if the input is valid or an error reason if the input is invalid.

      • validateMission

        public java.lang.String validateMission(java.lang.String fieldNameKey,
                                        java.lang.String missionLbl,
                                        java.lang.String instrFld,
                                        java.lang.String instrLbl)
        Indicate whether or not a parameter which is the higher value in a range is acceptable, ie that it is greater than a low value and between a range of acceptable limits.
        Parameters:
        fieldNameKey - the mission
        missionLbl - The name of the GUI input box label.
        instrFld - The name of the instrument field
        instrLbl - The name of the instrument label
        Returns:
        null if the input is valid or an error reason if the input is invalid.

      • getProcessedError

        protected java.lang.String getProcessedError(java.lang.String error,
                                             java.lang.String label,
                                             java.lang.String fieldNameKey)
        If there is an error, update the label and return the error string with the field name prepended.
        Parameters:
        error - The error indication, null iff no errors have occurred, a reason code otherwise.
        label - The name of the GUI input box label.
        fieldNameKey - The key for accessing the field name property.
        Returns:
        null if the input is valid or an error reason with the field name prepended if the input is invalid.

        protected void setFieldColor(java.lang.String fieldLabel,
                             java.lang.String code)
        Set the GUI field color to the provided color code.
        Parameters:
        fieldLabel - The GUI field label.
        code - The hex color code to assign. (eg: #FFFFFF)

      • inRange

        private boolean inRange(java.lang.Double value,
                        java.lang.String rangeKey)
        Return true IFF the provided value is within the specified range.
        Parameters:
        value - The double value to check.
        rangeKey - Toolkit property key for the range to apply.
        Returns:
        true iff the input is inclusively between the two bounds.

      • inRange

        private boolean inRange(java.lang.String value,
                        java.lang.String rangeKey)
        Return true IFF the provided value, when converted to Double, is within the specified range.
        Parameters:
        value - The raw string value.
        rangeKey - Toolkit property key for the range to apply.
        Returns:
        true iff the input is inclusively between the two bounds.
